title: Registration and verification
about: Participants can present the registration ID received via mail and acquire their FOSSMeet'23 ID card.

title: Inauguration & Opening Note
about: Dr. Sasi Kumar is a Free Software activist and a member of the Board of Directors of the Free Software Foundation of India. He has conducted research in atmospheric electricity, rainfall studies and cloud physics and has wrote popular science articles. He has also published three popular science books in Malayalam. He is an educationist and has been teaching school children for about a decade.

title: Building web apps in the open
about: Prabhanshu Gupta works as a developer for simple.org. Empowering over 9000 public healthcare organisations, it is a free and open-source application that provides a simple and contextual digital platform to help record patient data enabling the effective treatment of patients with hypertension. He is also a software engineer for Nilenso software and co-founded StreetHack, a company that turns innovative hackathon ideas into products.

title: Panel Discussion: Future of FOSS, Apocalypse or Utopia?
about: There is a lot of discussion and conjecture about the future of open-source software. On the one hand, some people see it as a paradise where community development, creativity, and cooperation lead to the production of trustworthy and high-quality applications. On the other hand, open-source struggles because of too many competing projects, lack of financing, and security issues. However, some data points to a promising future for accessible sources. The development of cutting-edge technology like artificial intelligence, cloud computing, and other technologies has given open-source software additional opportunities to prosper. FOSS initiatives concentrating on these fields are expected to get more attention and funding as these technologies develop. As a whole, open source software's future is a complicated and diverse topic. This panel discussion will focus on discussing the current state of open-source software while exploring possible directions of growth and challenges that will have to be overcome.
by: Andrew Bastin, Devdutt Shenoi, Gokul Soumya, Abraham Raji

title: Open Lab Session - place.git
about: This edition of FOSSMeet presents a live contribution project. Participants are tasked with writing python turtle code to draw any art of their choice or they can take up the challenge of completing specific art tasks with collaborators. These open lab sessions will serve as a great place to meet people with similar interests and learn to collaborate on a live project. Join us at place.git as we code a live canvas of art sourced entirely from participants of FOSSMeet.
prereqs: Follow this link to participate. Find the canvas here

title: Oxygenate your systems with FOSS
about: Dr. Deepika Kripanithi, a professor in the MCA department of RV College of Engineering, is a highly accomplished free software advocate and is an active member of the FOSS community. She believes in implementing FOSS wherever she can, so much so that she has inculcated FOSS into her Ph.D. thesis. Dr. Deepika has also worked on various communication technologies such as UWB, Lora, BLE, Wi-Fi, and GPS. A torchbearer for women in FOSS, she continues to mentor and motivate them to learn and contribute. She holds a global publication record, publishing over 15 papers, and 2 book chapters, and has over 150 citations to her .

title: Paperd.ink's Journey
about: He is the co-founder of paperd.ink, an open-source e-paper development board developed in India, that can also be programmed in Arduino IDE. After earning his B.Tech from MIT Pune, he currently works as a Marketing Manager at Inaza full-time. Furthermore, he has published some outstanding articles in the field of global economics and spectrum sensing techniques.

title: Enough of JavaScript build tools. Solving real world problems collaboratively through FOSS.
about: Known for his passion for free software, Dr. Akshay S Dinesh challenges the principle of personifying people based on their educational or professional backgrounds. Interestingly, he is an MBBS graduate and has done his postgraduate coursework in Medical Law and Ethics, a subject that deals with medico-legal issues. His accomplishments as a programmer include working in a non-profit organization and contributing to many open-source projects, such as Debian and Mozilla. Besides these, he is also a blogger and writes in three different domains: medicine, technology, and social commentary.

title: Git's Bit: Beyond the magic incantations
about: Atharva Raykar is an ardent FOSS enthusiast who is a Computer Science graduate from PES University, Bangalore. He is currently a software engineer at Nilenso and has previously worked as an intern for the Git Community as a part of the Google Summer of Code'21. Even while working as a full time engineer, he never shies away from sharing his knowledge and experience to youngsters and fellow FOSS enthusiasts, testimony to which is his initiative of an open source community by the name of Universities of FOSS, India.

title: Rust Workshop Session 1
about: Through this workshop, participants can expect to develop a thorough understanding of Rust, a multi-paradigm, high-level, general-purpose programming language that emphasizes performance, type safety, and concurrency.  Presented by Kerala Rustaceans, a Rust enthusiast community, based in Cochin.
learn: Primitive types such as floating point, bool, array, slice, tuples, etc.
If and loop expressions, addendum, strings, structures, and enum
prereqs: 2. Follow setup instructions for the workshop from this link

title: NeST Workshop Session 1
about: In this workshop, participants will get an in-depth understanding of network namespaces and NeST, a network simulation tool. The workshop is designed to cater to individuals who are interested in network virtualization, and simulating network topologies. By the end of the workshop, participants will have a thorough understanding of network namespaces and NeST and how to use it for network simulation. They will be able to create and run network simulations, and also get a glimpse of the advanced features of NeST.
learn: Creating a simple topology with namespaces
Going through some sample programs in NeST
A glance at the advanced features of NeST
prereqs: Before attending the workshop, participants are required to install NeST, which can be done from the website

title: Self Hosting 101: Session 1
about: The Self-Hosting workshop will show you the ropes on hosting and maintaining your own private server. Participants will be taught to keep websites and blogs running without depending on external services, and will be able to deploy and monitor their hosted application by using tools like htop and munin.
learn: Deploying a static website with Caddy
Deploying a dynamic website with systemd and Caddy
prereqs: 1. Some familiarity with Linux and shell
3. A Linux/MacOS system with common utilities installed

title: Lightning Talks
about: Lightning Talks gives you the opportunity to gain insight into the latest trends in technology and open-source software in an instant. Delivered by young FOSS enthusiasts, these talks will help bring you up to speed on various topics. Lightning talks on the following topics have been scheduled for FOSSMeet'23:
by: Arya Kiran, Nandakishore M Pai, Gokul Soumya, Mujeeb Rahman
topics: Open-Source and importance of documentation, Journey of building an ML open source project to integrating it with Snapchat - Nanda Kishor M Pai
Free Software, Decentralization, Self-Hosting and Free Service Hosts - Arya Kiran
The Helix text editor - Gokul Soumya
Desktop publishing and FOSS, A success story  - Mujeeb Rahman K

title: AI for solving regional problems
about: He is a machine learning engineer at FullContact Inc. and runs project initiatives for the TinkerHub Foundation. Hailing from Kottayam, Kerala, he has completed his B.Tech in Computer engineering from the Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Technology, Kottayam, where he founded the RIT Chapter of Tinkerhub and worked on a Computer Vision project whilst implementing the Pytorch Learning Program. In addition, Mr.Sashikumar has several stimulating open-source projects under his belt. RITA - a virtual voice assistant, and JOJI- a project that converts text to a corresponding emoji, are a few among his impressive array of projects.

title: Introduction to Debian GNU/Linux
about: Abraham Raji is a free software developer and an official member of the Debian Project (Debian Developer) hailing from Kottayam, Kerala. He is an advocate for free software, open hardware, open design and above all promotes the hacker culture. Additionally, he has organized multiple events across the state to bring awareness towards these causes. He was a speaker at various conferences and events, namely the DebConf 2022, DevConf 2019 and MEC Conf 2019. He was also the state-level event coordinator for the NASA Space Apps Challenge 2019. He is currently working at Big Binary as a full-stack developer.

title: From Kerala to the world: Hoppscotch's Story
about: Andrew Bastin is the co-founder and CTO of Hoppscotch. As a web-based API development suite, Hoppscotch provides an easy and accessible platform to developers with a minimalist UI. It is a completely open-source and free-to-use suite. Pursuing a Bachelor's in Computer Science at Lakehead University, Canada, Andrew is deeply committed to Open Source development. In this edition of FOSSMeet, let's join him as he recalls his journey in turning an idea into a thriving venture.

title: Open Source Beginner Experience: Contributing to large projects like webTorrent
about: Subin Siby is a tech lead at Big Binary, a company that has a track record of building high-quality web and mobile software with proven results. His foray into the world of programming started at a very young age. The first project that he worked on, a social network called Open was also his first encounter with open source software. A curious learner by nature who is also very passionate about sharing the knowledge he's acquired, Subin runs a blog with over 300 tutorials that shed light on topics that aren't covered extensively on the internet. He also plays an instrumental role in the Varnam Project that deals with the transliteration of Indian languages.

title: Closing note
about: Until next time, see you all again very soon!
